Legal_Issue: Whether the Royal Bank sufficiently used the trademark 'Informaction' to avoid expungement under s. 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Evidence_Assessment: Vague evidence of reintroduction; lack of proof of use in normal course of trade
Burden_of_Proof: On the Royal Bank to demonstrate use or special circumstances for nonuse
Credibility_Factor: Low credibility due to vague and internal-only use evidence
Legal_Rule: A trademark must be used in the normal course of trade to distinguish wares or services; nonuse may be excused by special circumstances
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, based on Federal Court review standards
Procedural_Issue: Federal Court reviewing Registrar's expungement decision with new evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Challenge to expungement of trademark registration for nonuse
Outcome_on_Merits: Royal Bank failed to prove sufficient use or special circumstances
Review_Standard: Statutory interpretation and application of s. 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court considered new evidence and legal precedents
Key_Evidence_Considered: Internal use of 'Informaction', lack of public or commercial use from 1986â€“1991
Applicant_Challenge: Royal Bank challenged Registrar's expungement decision
Court_Result: Trademark 'Informaction' expunged; appeal dismissed with costs
Defendant_Response: Registrar maintained expungement based on nonuse
Evidence_Type: Documentary and testimonial evidence of trademark use
Applicable_Process: Administrative review followed by judicial appeal
Governing_Rule: Use in the normal course of trade required; special circumstances may excuse nonuse
